main event: A bright, silent object was observed in Prescott, Arizona on September 29, 1956, moving across the sky at a great rate of speed and displaying slight oscillating movement, possibly rotating or pulsating slowly. It appeared to be dropping with reddish light and was initially seen as a glow, increasing in size and brilliance as it moved across the sky.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 25,000 to 30,000 feet in altitude, possibly the size of a conventional aircraft, but its aerodynamic features and type were not determined.
It was observed by a number of persons and watched and timed, with the conclusion that it moved silently and at a great rate of speed, but no trail or exhaust was observed.
The observers, Mr. and Mrs. L, described the object as a silvery, shiny disc-like object that hovered over the area for a few minutes before accelerating and disappearing from sight.
The report indicates that it was possibly a meteor, with insufficient data for a conclusion but no further action was contemplated by the office.
The sighting was observed by credible witnesses and the investigation of the object yielded no data.
sighted object: bright, silent object with reddish light
